review: I've gone through about every set top box like this there is. Roku, OUYA, AppleTV, etc. So far this has been my favorite. Most of the others were lacking in A/V format support, buggy, or underpowered. It's been smooth sailing so far with FireTV. I mainly use it as my media center with the Plex app. The image quality and speed is very nice. I wish they had more surround sound audio options, but I hear that's coming in the future. No complaints. I would like to see the search feature to be integrated into more apps as well.
author: Brandon

review: Could not be more pleased. Works as advertised, is very quick and menu is well organized. The remote with voice works very well, and I have trouble with voice control on cell phones. If you can afford this over the USB FireTV Stick, get it - the remote and ability to use it on your LAN make it much more flexible. While menu does make it easy to  get to  Amazon materials, I disagree with review comments that said it favored Amazon sources at the expense of other sources - my searches of the visible menu and by voice search seemed neutral to me -  I would get selections from Netfix, etc. as much as from Amazon. This is one fine box. Incidentally, I have it hooked up through a DVDO signal processor/enhancer vice running the output straight to my TV, and it worked on HDMI right out of the box. I also like the addional digital audio OUT port - it works at the same time as the sound on the HDMI port, so I run sound to both my speakers and to my wireless headset for flexibility in the evening. I only use it to watch content on a good TV - I have never been a fan of watching video on these small portable platforms that have so much of the advertising directed to them, so cannot comment on that aspect of the device.
